com.github.methylene.sym

Class Rankings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.methylene.sym.Rankings

  • public final class Rankings
extends Object
    A collection of methods that return rankings, or operate on rankings.

    • Method Detail

      • isRanking

        public static boolean isRanking(int[] a)
        Check that the input is a ranking. Each non-negative integer less than a.length must appear exactly once.
        Parameters:
        a - an array
        Returns:
        true if a is a ranking

      • identity

        public static int[] identity(int length)
        Return the identity ranking
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the ranking
        Returns:
        the identity ranking of the given length

        Ensure that the input is a ranking.
        Parameters:
        a - an array
        Returns:
        the input array
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a is not a ranking

      • nextOffset

        public static int nextOffset(int idx,
             int offset,
             int[] sorted)
        Find the next position, after idx + offset, of sorted[idx] in a sorted array. For a given element el, iterating this method over the offset element, starting with offset = 0, will enumerate all positions of sorted[idx] in the sorted array.
        Parameters:
        idx - the start index
        offset - the current offset from the start index
        sorted - a sorted array
        Returns:
        the next offset or 0 if there is no next offset

      • nextOffset

      • shift

        public static int shift(int i)
        Encode an int as a non-zero int
        Parameters:
        i - an int
        Returns:
        i + 1 if i is non-negative, otherwise i

      • unshift

        public static int unshift(int i)
        Undo the shift
        Parameters:
        i - a non-zero int
        Returns:
        i - 1 if i is positive, otherwise i
        See Also:
        shift(int)

      • sort

        public static int[] sort(int[] a)
        Produce a particular ranking that sorts the input when applied to it. For each index i < a.length, the return value satisfies the following property. Let 
        
   int[] sort = sort(a);
   int[] sorted = apply(sort, a);
   int[] unsort = invert(sort);
   int idx = Arrays.binarySearch(sorted, el);
        then for each index i < a.length, the following is true: 
        
   Util.indexOf(a, el, 0) == unsort[idx]
        Parameters:
        a - an array
        Returns:
        a ranking that sorts the input
        See Also:
        apply(int[], int[]), Util.indexOf(int[], int, int)

      • sort

        public static <E extends Comparable> int[] sort(E[] a)
        Produce a particular ranking that sorts the input when applied to it. For each index i < a.length, the return value satisfies the following property. Let 
        
   int[] sort = sort(a);
   int[] sorted = apply(sort, a);
   int[] unsort = invert(sort);
   int idx = Arrays.binarySearch(sorted, el);
        then for each index i < a.length, the following is true: 
        
   Util.indexOf(a, el, 0) == unsort[idx]

        Throws:

        See Also:

        public static int[] from(int[] a,
         int[] b)
        Produce a particular ranking that produces b when applied to a.
        Parameters:
        a - an array
        b - an array
        Returns:

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if b can not be obtained by rearranging a

      • apply

        public static Object[] apply(int[] ranking,
             Object[] input)
        Apply the ranking to the input array. An element at i is moved to ranking[i]. Indexes that are greater or equal to the length of the ranking are not moved. This method does not check that the first argument is indeed a ranking.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        input - an input array
        Returns:
        the result of applying the ranking to the input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length of input is less than the length of ranking

      • apply

        public static Comparable[] apply(int[] ranking,
                 Comparable[] input)
        Apply the ranking to the input array. An element at i is moved to ranking[i]. Indexes that are greater or equal to the length of the ranking are not moved. This method does not validate that the first argument is indeed a ranking.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        input - an input array
        Returns:
        the result of applying the ranking to the input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length of input is less than the length of ranking
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - can be thrown if the ranking argument is not a ranking
        See Also:
        isRanking(int[])

      • apply

        public static String[] apply(int[] ranking,
             String[] input)
        Apply the ranking to the input array. An element at i is moved to ranking[i]. Indexes that are greater or equal to the length of the ranking are not moved. This method does not validate that the first argument is indeed a ranking.

        Returns:
